message.entry: Add a callback function to make your app respond to user interactions such as button clicks.
Add a function to organize your code into helper or utility functions. Call the function with app as the first input argument:
Add app properties to share data

entry.note: holes are to add code styling. Do not translate 'app.'. this is followed by a code example

message.entry: Add a property to create a variable to store and share data between callbacks and functions. Specify the property name with the prefix {0}app.{1} to access the property value:
These are the components that you can access programmatically.
Double click on a component to rename it.

entry.note: holes are to add code styling. Do not translate app.Component.Property. this is followed by a code example

message.entry: Advanced: Add functions or share data
Read-only generated code has been updated to match your latest preferences for the MATLAB editor. Would you like to apply smart-indentation to the rest of your code?
Add an event to create a new public callback. Public callbacks are accessible when the component is added to an app.
Add a function to organize your code into helper or utility functions
Add a property to create a variable to store and share data between callbacks and functions
Learn about managing your app code in Code View.
You can show or hide tips at any time by clicking the {0} button in the View tab.
